Drinks.name: Old Fashioned
Drinks.directions: Muddle the sugar cube and bitters with one bar spoon of water at the bottom of a chilled rocks glass. (If using simple syrup, combine bitters and one bar spoon of syrup.) Add rye or bourbon. Stir. Add one large ice cube, or three or four smaller cubes. Stir until chilled and properly diluted, about 30 seconds. Slip orange twist on the side of the cube.

Drinks.name: Bourbon Lemonade
Drinks.directions: Serve on the rocks or blend with ice, in a rocks glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.

Drinks.name: Bourbon Sour
ingredients: 3/4 ounce (1 1/2 tablespoons) pure maple syrup (or simple syrup)
Garnish: Orange peel and a cocktail cherry
Drinks.directions: Add the bourbon whiskey, lemon juice, and syrup to a cocktail shaker. Fill with a handful of ice and shake until very cold. Strain the drink into a lowball or Old Fashioned glass. Serve with ice, an orange peel and a cocktail cherry.

Drinks.name: Rum Punch
Drinks.directions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a Hurricane glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a brandied cherry.

Drinks.name: Caribeno
ingredients: 1/4 oz Rich simple syrup (2 parts sugar, 1 part water)
Drinks.directions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake. Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice. Squeeze a lime wedge into the glass and drop it in the drink to garnish.

Drinks.name: Manhattan Cocktail
ingredients: 2 ounces rye whiskey, bourbon, or Canadian whiskey
Drinks.directions: Pour the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with cherry.

Drinks.name: Classic Bourbon Mint Julep
Drinks.directions: Place the mint leaves and sugar or simple syrup into a julep cup, collins glass, or double old-fashioned glass. Muddle well to dissolve the sugar and release the oil and aroma of the mint. Add the bourbon. Fill the glass with crushed ice and stir well until the glass becomes frosty. Garnish with a mint sprig. Serve with a straw and enjoy!

Drinks.name: Moscow Mule
Drinks.directions: Pour vodka and lime juice into a mug; add ice cubes and ginger beer. Stir to combine. Drop a lime wedge into the mug for garnish.

Drinks.name: Passion Fruit Martini
ingredients: 2 ripe passion fruits (they should have a crinkly appearance), halved
Drinks.directions: Scoop the seeds from one of the passion fruits into the glass of a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, passoa, lime juice and sugar syrup. Add a handful of ice and shake well, strain into 2 martini glasses, top up with prosecco, then add half a passion fruit to each. Serve immediately.

Drinks.name: English Garden Cocktail
Drinks.directions: Shake all the ingredients except the cucumber with ice and strain into a tall glass with filled with fresh ice. Decorate with cucumber ribbons to serve.

Drinks.name: Gin and Tonic
Drinks.directions: In a highball glass filled with ice cubes, pour the gin, then top with tonic. Stir well. Garnish with a lime wedge.

Drinks.name: Blue Hawaiian
ingredients: Garnish: maraschino cherry and pineapple wedge
Drinks.directions: In a mixing glass filled with ice cubes, pour the rum, blue curaçao, cream of coconut, and pineapple juice. Stir well for at least 30 seconds. Strain into a collins glass filled with fresh ice cubes. Garnish with the cherry and pineapple wedge.

Drinks.name: Blue Mermaid Cocktail
ingredients: ¼ cup ground Graham Crackers (for rimming)
Drinks.directions: Wet rim of a short cocktail glass with rum. Grind Graham crackers in food processor or blender. Place ground Graham crackers on a dish and roll wet rim in Graham crackers. Add ice to the rimmed cocktail glass. Pour in Malibu Rum, Blue Curaçao, Blue UV Vodka, and pineapple juice. Stir lightly to combine. Give a small stir. Add two slices of pineapple to the side of the glass, one maraschino cherry and a cocktail umbrella for garnish to complete the tropical look. Serve it up on top of a tray strewn with extra ground Graham crackers for a sandy beach tray!

Drinks.name: Mudslide
Drinks.directions: Shake Kahlúa, Vodka and Irish cream Liqueur in a shaker with lots of ice. Serve in a rocks glass with ice. Easy does it. Tip: to make it look even more delicious, add some chocolate flakes on top, because... who says you can't indulge?

Drinks.name: Kahlua Iced Coffee
Drinks.directions: Fill any cup or glass or even a carafe or something (if you're brunching with friends) with ice and iced coffee. Then just add Kahlúa, mix, and sip at your own pace.

Drinks.name: Espresso Martini
Drinks.directions: Ok, you’ll need an espresso machine and a shaker for this one. It sounds complicated but it’s just a matter of mixing booze with coffee. Shake the Kahlúa, Absolut Vodka and espresso together with plenty of ice. Strain into a cocktail glass to get rid of all the small ice chips. Tip: Shake for like 10 seconds for optimal frothiness.

Drinks.name: Tequila Oasis
ingredients: 3/4 ounce lime juice and 1/2 ounce triple sec
Drinks.directions: Shake in a shaker with ice. Strain into an ice-filled glass. Garnish with a lime twist.

Drinks.name: Mojitorita Cocktail
ingredients: 1 cup fresh mint leaves, plus more for garnish
Cold soda water or sparkling water
Drinks.directions: Tear the mint leaves into pieces and put 1/2 cup into a cocktail shaker with 1/4 cup lime juice, 1 tablespoon sugar, and 4 ounces tequila. Add crushed ice and shake well. Strain over ice into high ball glasses and top off with soda water. Garnish with mint leaves and lime slices. Empty the shaker and repeat the steps to make the remaining 2 drinks.

Drinks.name: Mexican Mule
Drinks.directions: Chill the ginger ale ahead of preparing this drink. Fill your cocktail shaker with ice Measure and pour the tequila, lime juice and simple syrup into a cocktail shaker. Shake vigorously until very cold. Fill a Highball glass with ice. Strain the drink from the shaker into your glass. Top your glass off with the chilled ginger ale. Garnish and serve.

Drinks.name: Baileys Almande Peach Smoothie
Drinks.directions: Place the Baileys Almande Almondmilk Liqueur, ice cubes, vanilla and chopped peach in a blender and blend until you like the consistency. Mix the icing sugar with a few drops of water to make a smooth thick paste. Coat the rim of two glasses with it, then dip them in the coconut shavings, press to secure them on. Pour the Baileys mixture into the glass and top it off with mint leaves and a peach slice. Peachy, tasty and not long until it’s gone.

Drinks.name: Baileys Tiramisu Cocktail
ingredients: Cocoa powder, chocolate coffee beans and chocolate flakes to garnish
Drinks.directions: Mix the hot coffee with the sugar and chocolate until smooth, then leave aside to cool. Blend the Baileys and biscuit crumbs with four ice cubes in a blender or smoothie maker until smooth. Put the mascarpone in a bowl, add about a third of the Baileys mixture and mix together with a little balloon whisk until smooth. Fold in the rest with a spoon. Pour the coffee mixture into two martini cocktail glasses, then spoon over the Baileys mascarpone mix. Dust with the cocoa powder then sprinkle over coffee beans, chocolate flakes and curls.

Drinks.name: Baileys White Russian
Drinks.directions: Pour all ingredients into a glass with ice and stir. Combine in a glass and mix. Garnish with Maraschino Cherry.

Drinks.name: Brandy Old-Fashioned Sweet
Drinks.directions: In a rocks glass, muddle orange slice, cherry, cherry juice and bitters. Add ice. Pour in the brandy, water, orange juice and soda.

Drinks.name: Brandy Cocktail
Drinks.directions: In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, pour the brandy, curaçao, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon peel.

Drinks.name: Strawberry Scotch Cocktail
ingredients: 5 fresh lemon thyme or regular thyme springs
2 ounces soda water or sparkling water
Drinks.directions: Muddle the strawberries and thyme springs in a cocktail shaker. Add ice, Scotch, lemon juice, and vanilla simple syrup. Shake. Strain the cocktail into a Collins glass or a wine glass, and top with soda water. Strain the cocktail into a Collins glass or a wine glass, and top with soda water.

Drinks.name: Cinnamon Honey Scotch Sour Cocktail
Drinks.directions: Make the syrup: In a small saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil with the cinnamon sticks. Remove from heat and let sit for 10 minutes. Stir in honey and refrigerate overnight. The next day, discard the cinnamon sticks. Make the cocktail: Combine Scotch, lemon juice, and syrup in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously into a rocks glass filled with ice.

Drinks.name: Perfect spritz
Drinks.directions: Pour both types of vermouth and the gin into a clean glass bottle or jug and add the dried lavender. Stir and leave to infuse overnight (in the fridge or in a cupboard). Allow 50ml per person and strain into glasses over ice. Serve neat with lots of ice or top with soda or tonic water and add some lemon wedges and a sprig of lavender.

Drinks.name: Negroni Sbagliato
Drinks.directions: In a highball glass pour the Campari and sweet vermouth, add cubed ice and gently add in the prosecco – pouring it down a bar or long spoon that's been placed in the glass will stop the bubbles roaming over the edge of the glass. Stir contents of the glass together, top up further and garnish with the orange slice.

Drinks.name: Whiskey Smash
Drinks.directions: Muddle the lemon in a shaker. Add the remaining ingredients and ice and shake. Double-strain into a rocks glass over ice. Slap a mint sprig between your hands and use as garnish. Serve with a straw.

Drinks.name: Grapefruit Margarita
Drinks.directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add all the ingredients, shake until combined. Pour over ice and serve immediately. Garnish with lime or grapefruit wedge as desired.
